revised_title: Polar Properties in Dimethyl Acetylene: Intensities of Infra-Red Bands
tldr: The authors determined the absolute intensities of most of the infrared fundamental vibration bands of dimethyl acetylene and used these results to calculate polar properties of the C-H and C-C bonds. They found that if the acetylenic carbon atoms carry a residual negative charge, the hydrogen in the C-H bonds must carry a residual positive charge. The probable dipole moment is about 0.4 Debye, and the bond dipole moment is around 1 Debye. These findings provide insights into the chemical bonding and molecular vibrations of dimethyl acetylene.
